name: AP2
summary: Mandates (cryptographic proofs of user intent) are a sophisticated answer to 'did the human actually want this?' But 60+ corporate partners and payment-agnostic design means AP2 could become the invisible rails beneath all agentic commerce — an implicit protocol governing every transaction.

feedbackLoop.note: Mandates create auditable proof of authorization. Clear paper trail.

edgeCases.note: Payment-agnostic (cards, crypto, bank transfers) means many edge cases per payment method.

ambiguity.note: Delegated tasks ('buy tickets when available') have ambiguous success criteria.

redundancy.note: x402, AITP payments, and AP2 all compete in agent payments. A2A x402 extension adds another layer.

nesting.note: AP2 → A2A → x402 extension creates a 3-layer payment stack.

exitCost.note: 60+ partners including Mastercard, PayPal, Amex. Once merchants integrate, switching is extremely costly.

identityPenetration.note: Not yet — but commerce protocols historically become invisible infrastructure (credit card networks).

agencyPreservation.note: Intent Mandates preserve some agency, but delegated mandates ('buy when you see a deal') hand control to the agent.

controlInvisibility.note: Payment protocols are the canonical example of invisible control. Visa's protocol governs billions of transactions, yet nobody 'sees' it.

crisisMindset.note: 'Agentic commerce is coming whether you're ready or not' — urgency framing from Google.
